bug.author: guihao-liang
bug.summary: image classifier feature extractor segfault on Linux
bug.description:
<denchmark-code>toolkits/test_image_classifier.py::ImageClassifierSqueezeNetTest::test_predict_topk Fatal Python error: Segmentation fault
...
Thread 0x00007f4d91ffb700 (most recent call first): File "/usr/lib/python3.6/threading.py", line 295 in wait File "/usr/lib/python3.6/queue.py", line 164 in get File "/usr/lib/python3.6/multiprocessing/pool.py", line 108 in worker File "/usr/lib/python3.6/threading.py", line 864 in run File "/usr/lib/python3.6/threading.py", line 916 in _bootstrap_inner File "/usr/lib/python3.6/threading.py", line 884 in _bootstrap

comments.comment: The initial guess is the last batch returned by next_batch is not filled in batch size.
Is this the same issue as <denchmark-link:https://github.com/apple/turicreate/issues/3079>#3079</denchmark-link> ?

Is this the same issue as #3079?
right. I thought it's fixed, but it happened again.
The issue only happens intermittently. Nothing with the image classifier has changed in a long time. I would guess itâ€™s more likely to be an issue with the machine than with our code.
The stack trace seems to be the same as <denchmark-link:https://github.com/apple/turicreate/issues/3044>#3044</denchmark-link> . Closing as a duplicate.
